snippet: At least 64 people were killed, including residents who had been shopping in markets, soldiers on patrol and seven truck drivers who were found dead from gunshot wounds.
abstract: Militants launch lethal and coordinated car bombings in Baghdad, killing truck drivers outside the city and detonating explosives at a funeral tent in a village; at least 64 people are killed in what is considered one of the deadliest outbreaks of violence in Iraq so far this year.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and DURAID ADNAN

lead_paragraph: At least 64 people were killed, including residents who had been shopping in markets, soldiers on patrol and seven truck drivers who were found dead from gunshot wounds.

headline.main: Militants Unleash Wave of Violence in Iraq, Killing Dozens
headline.print_headline: Militants Unleash Wave of Violence in Iraq, Killing Dozens
